shortdesc.ph: The statistics of the local video stream.

plentry.pd: The ID of the local user.

pd.p: The actual bitrate (Kbps) while sending the local video stream.This value does not include the bitrate for resending the video after packet loss.

plentry.pd: The actual frame rate (fps) while sending the local video stream.This value does not include the frame rate for resending the video after packet loss.
The frame rate (fps) for capturing the local video stream.
The width (px) for capturing the local video stream.
The height (px) for capturing the local video stream.

The frame rate (fps) adjusted by the built-in video capture adapter (regulator) of the SDK for capturing the local video stream. The regulator adjusts the frame rate of the video captured by the camera according to the video encoding configuration.

The width (px) adjusted by the built-in video capture adapter (regulator) of the SDK for capturing the local video stream. The regulator adjusts the height of the video captured by the camera according to the video encoding configuration.

The height (px) adjusted by the built-in video capture adapter (regulator) of the SDK for capturing the local video stream. The regulator adjusts the height of the video captured by the camera according to the video encoding configuration.
The output frame rate (fps) of the local video encoder.
The output frame rate (fps) of the local video renderer.
The target bitrate (Kbps) of the current encoder. This is an estimate made by the SDK based on the current network conditions.
The target frame rate (fps) of the current encoder.

pd.ph: Quality adaption of the local video stream in the reported interval (based on the target frame rate and target bitrate).

ul.li: (0): The local video quality stays the same.
(1): The local video quality improves because the network bandwidth increases.
(2): The local video quality deteriorates because the network bandwidth decreases.

pd.p: The bitrate (Kbps) while encoding the local video stream.This value does not include the bitrate for resending the video after packet loss.

plentry.pd: The width of the encoded video (px).
The height of the encoded video (px).
The number of the sent video frames, represented by an aggregate value.

pd.ph: The codec type of the local video.

plentry.pd: The video packet loss rate (%) from the local client to the Agora server before applying the anti-packet loss strategies.
The brightness level of the video image captured by the local camera. See .

The brightness level of the video image captured by the local camera.
(-1): The SDK does not detect the brightness level of the video image. Wait a few seconds to get the brightness level from captureBrightnessLevel in the next callback.
(0): The brightness level of the video image is normal.
(1): The brightness level of the video image is too bright.
(2): The brightness level of the video image is too dark.
